I won't delve on the other reviews (just smh), but will say this: if you are serious about taking control of your camera you need this app. If your phone has camera2 API support this will give you access to all those regular manual settings, but also will let you adjust noise reduction and edge enhancement. That makes it possible to override overzealous post processing in default camera apps. You can make photos that look more like classic analog ones with noise instead of digital patterns or make overprocessed video (like on LG G6) look really natural, which is amazing.
This app is great, in fact better than any other camera apps I've used but the only downside is that it does not have a histogram. Otherwise it's great.

Wait, where's the flash????? This review is for my personal reminder later 
when searching apps for future phones and does not necessarily reflect my 
feelings about the app, BUT, decent app. Allowed full control of ISO, 
shutter speed, and focal distance within the hardware's capabilities. 
However, the interface gets a little kludgey when all options are present. 
Fortunately, the app gives control over what features are expressed in the 
GUI and the app is quite small in storage compared to other "full manual" 
camera apps. Might just be a keeper. LG G5 (H830), Android 7.1.2 
Resurrection Remix ROM

color which cannot be fixed by any amount of editing.
lots of paid apps cant handle this much work. Just thank you 👍

A very nice continuation of Open Camera: flexible GUI and controls. One 
feature that's missing for me is a framerate toggle somewhere on the video 
camera screen. Right now, it is buried deep in the settings menu and 
difficult to change as a result.

The level of stupidity & unmitigated ignorance never ceases to amaze me 
when reading reviews with as much erudition as Peter Griffin sticking his 
male appendage into a pencil sharpener. So, for those like Peter, HedgeCam 
legally & freely uses Open Camera code, since OpenCam is an open source 
camera app licensed under the GPL v3. They give away their code for others 
to build, enhance, & expand. And since most of you ostrich heads don't know 
what that means, lets try a metaphor.... open source code can be likened to 
sharing a recipe for others to enjoy & pass on without consequence. 
Everyone has different tastes, allergies, & ideas. And as such, both the 
original chef & those adding their own flare, end up enriching the lives of 
many on a divine mouthwatering scrumdiddlyumptious tour of the palate. I 
hope that helps, but hell, we all know you can't fix stupid.
The ability to change hdr algorithm is so awesome!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can change it in the settings. Preferences - Preview - Maximal preview size.

I've tried multiple manual camera apps on play store and this is the most 
customizable and efficient camera app out there! Though now I am getting 
the error 'Serious camera error' whenever I load up the app. Any help? 
Using a Xperia XZ

Advanced indeed. I seem to have a lot of control over the camera using 
this. Shutter Speed(?), ISO adjustments, and also (this is what gets me 
excited) MANUAL FOCUS, I don't know why but other camera app don't seem to 
have it..Great! Edit: I tried capturing in RAW. The DNG files that are 
saved cannot be opened or converted on any program. I've tried (Photshop 
CS6, UFRAW). I've also tried to convert it to a dng compatible with 
Photoshop, but the converter doesn't see a "valid dng file" also tried 
using mobile app to convert it and same result. If you have any idea why 
this happens, please contact me. Thank you.
